result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah M Harris

Defendant Isaiah M Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Anthony D Cotton appeared by video for Isaiah M Harris.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel advises that they are now in a resolution posture. Case adjourned for a plea hearing date to Br 16.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-28-22

Defendant Isaiah M Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Anthony D Cotton in court for Isaiah M Harris.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Decision Hearing. Court placed on the record findings of fact and legal analysis. Court GRANTED State's Motion for joinder. Defense requests a Status Conference date. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed.Pretrial Services Supervision Report
Received and Filed. STATES RESPONSE TO MOTION
Defense requests bail modification on driving priveleges. Arguments heard. Court denied bail motion for todays purposes.

Defendant Isaiah M Harris in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Motion Hearing. All parties appeared via zoom. Arguments heard. Court addresses parties and states that she is not prepared to rule on the motion today, due to reasons put forth on the record. Court adjourns matter for a Decision hearing date to Br 16.  Decision scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-4-22
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Conditions of Bail received and filed.  bm

Defendant Isaiah M Harris in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 16.   Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-6-22

Defendant Isaiah M Harris in court with Attorney Brad Novreske on behalf of Attorney Anthony D Cotton; they appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with MML, IN, CAP-F, , and no contact with co-defendants.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving at all.

Defendant Isaiah M Harris in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Defendant Isaiah M Harris in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
